proof-by-contradiction-2

Definition

proof-by-contradiction-2 is the inference-rule:

\[\left( \mathcal{H} assume \not \mathbf{P}, Inc\left(\mathcal{H}\right) \right) \vdash \mathbf{P}\]

Python implementation

ProofByContradiction2Declaration

class core.ProofByContradiction2Declaration(universe_of_discourse, echo=None)
__init__(universe_of_discourse, echo=None)
compose_paragraph_proof(o)

This method should be overridden by specialized inference-rule classes to provide accurate proofs.

Return type:

Generator[Composable, Composable, bool]

infer_formula(x_neq_y_hypothesis, inc_hypothesis, t, echo=None)

Apply this inference-rules on input statements and return the resulting statement.

verify_args(x_neq_y_hypothesis, inc_hypothesis, t, echo=None)
Parameters:

  • x_neq_y_hypothesis – The hypothesis-statement in the parent theory.

  • inc_hypothesis – The contradiction-statement Inc(Tn) where Tn is the hypothesis-theory.

  • t – The current (parent) theory.

  • echo –

Returns:
